content.description: Short climb with an obvious crux through a strenuous flare.  Not sure you could call it fun but it's good practice on clean rock.
content.location: Left most route on the crag, easily identified by the flare.

content.description: This slightly adventurous lead tackles the right side of the slab on the wall. Work your feet on small but adequate edges past thin pro.
content.location: Climb up just left of the arete, finishing at a bolted anchor after pulling onto the top of the slab.

content.description: Follow the obvious crack that's right of the right facing corner.  Half way up it switches from trad/crack climbing, to face climbing.  The upper section is bolted with chain anchors.
content.protection: SR to 2", 6(?) bolts with chain anchors
content.location: This is the low angled wall right of Arms Control. Start from the ground

content.description: Listed as a bold lead in the Kramar guide this route has been retro bolted except the top and is safe.  Probably two ways to finish and we went right into some easy loose blocks with some lichen.  Not a great climb but adds another route to the crag.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a couple cams for the top. Fixed anchor.
content.location: First route on the left side of the arête next to Arms Control.

content.description: Straightforward crack climbing with a variety of movement.  Well protected and fun.
content.protection:
Mainly finger sized pieces and I placed a couple one inch cams

at the top. Fixed anchors.
content.location: Most obvious crack climb starting on the right side of an arête at the west end of the rock.
